verses.text: 弟兄們，我不願意你們不知道，我們的祖宗都曾經在雲下，都曾經從海中經過，

words.note: Common address for fellow believers.

verses.text: 都曾經在雲裡在海裡受洗歸於摩西。

words.note: Lit. 'receive washing'.
Indicates devotion or allegiance.

verses.text: 他們都吃了一樣的靈糧，

words.note: Refers to Manna or spiritual sustenance.

verses.text: 都喝了一樣的靈水；他們所喝的，是從那隨著他們的靈磐石那裡來的，這磐石就是基督。

words.note: Refers to water from the rock, spiritual sustenance.
Indicates the object of the following verb.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'that which was drunk'.
Refers to the rock that Moses struck (Exodus 17:6), interpreted as Christ.

verses.text: 但他們大多數的人，都得不到 神的喜悅，因此他們都死在曠野。

words.note: Negative potential complement of '得...到'.
In many Chinese Bibles, '神' is preceded by a reverential space or symbol.

verses.text: 這些事都是我們的鑒戒，叫我們不要貪戀惡事，像他們那樣。

words.note: A lesson or example to avoid repeating mistakes.

verses.text: 你們也不可拜偶像，像他們有些人那樣；正如經上所記：「人民坐下吃喝，起來玩樂。」

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon, or emphasizes a known action.

verses.text: 我們也不可淫亂，像他們有些人那樣，一天就死了二萬三千人。
我們也不可試探主，像他們有些人那樣，結果就被蛇咬死了。

words.note: Often refers to testing God or spiritual temptation.

verses.text: 你們也不可發怨言，像他們有些人那樣，就被那毀滅者所滅。

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon, or emphasizes a known action.

verses.text: 這些事發生在他們身上，作為鑒戒，並且記下來，為了要警戒我們這些末世的人。

words.note: Refers to 'among them' or 'to them' rather than literally 'on their bodies'.
A lesson or warning from the past.
Refers to the eschatological period.

verses.text: 所以，那自以為站得穩的，應當謹慎，免得跌倒。

words.note: Used as a demonstrative pronoun to refer to 'those who'.
V+得+Adj structure indicating ability or result.

verses.text: 你們所受的試探，無非是人受得起的； 神是信實的，他必不容許你們受試探過於你們抵受得住的，而且在受試探的時候，必定給你們開一條出路，使你們能忍受得住。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'that which is V-ed'.
V+得+Result complement indicating capability.
Commonly used in Christian contexts for God's faithfulness.
Verb-object compound: 'undergo temptation'.
V+得+Result complement, indicating successful resistance/endurance.
Used here to form a temporal noun phrase 'during the time of being tempted'.
V+得+Result complement, indicating successful endurance.

verses.text: 所以，我所親愛的，你們要遠避拜偶像的事。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'that which is V-ed'.
Verb-object compound: 'worship idols'.

verses.heading: Avoid Idol Feasts

verses.text: 我是對明白事理的人說的，我所說的你們要自己判斷。

words.note: Idiomatic phrase meaning 'sensible' or 'reasonable'.
Used at the end of a sentence to emphasize certainty or indicate a completed action in a '是...的' construction.
Forms a noun phrase from a verb, e.g., 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 我們為福杯祝禱的時候，難道不是共享基督的血嗎？我們擘餅的時候，難道不是共享基督的身體嗎？

words.note: Refers to the cup in the Lord's Supper.
Contextually refers to Christ's atoning blood.
Refers to the act of breaking bread in the Lord's Supper.
Contextually refers to the body of Christ (church) or Christ's physical body.

verses.text: 因為事實上只有一個餅，我們人數雖多，還是一個身體，因為我們都是分享同一個餅。

words.note: Here, 'body' refers to the unified body of believers (the Church).

verses.text: 你們看看按肉身是以色列人，那些吃祭物的不就是與祭壇有分嗎？

words.note: Reduplication indicates a casual or repeated action.
In a biblical context, often refers to human nature or physical existence.
Used to express a rhetorical question or emphasis.
Implies communion or participation in a religious rite.

verses.text: 我說的是甚麼意思呢？偶像算得甚麼，還是祭過偶像的食物算得甚麼？

words.definition: what does it matter, what is it worth
what does it matter, what is it worth

verses.text: 我是說，教外人所祭的是鬼，不是獻給 神；我卻不願意你們與鬼來往。

words.note: Refers to non-Jews or non-believers.
The preceding space is a common stylistic choice in Chinese Bibles to show reverence for 'God'.

verses.text: 你們不能喝主的杯又喝鬼的杯，你們不能參加主的筵席又參加鬼的筵席。

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in biblical contexts.
In this context, often symbolic of destiny or experience.
Often used metaphorically in the Bible for spiritual fellowship.

verses.text: 難道我們要激起主的忿怒嗎？我們比他更強嗎？

words.note: Used to express rhetorical question or surprise.
Refers to divine wrath in religious contexts.
Used to form comparisons ('A 比 B adj').

verses.text: 神甚麼事情都可以作，但不是都有益處。甚麼事情都可以作，但不是都能造就人。

words.note: Capitalized 'Shén' refers to the one true God.
Often used in Christian contexts for spiritual growth.

verses.heading: Live to Glorify God

verses.text: 人不要求自己的好處，卻要求別人的好處。

words.note: Here implies 'don't (seek)'.
Here implies 'should (seek)'.

verses.text: 肉食市場所賣的一切，你們只管吃，不要為了良心的緣故問甚麼，

words.note: Indicates the preceding phrase is the object of the following verb.
Connects a descriptive phrase to a noun.
Emphasizes permission or lack of restriction.

words.definition: for the sake of, in order to

words.note: Here used as 'anything' in a negative or interrogative context.

verses.text: 因為地和地上所充滿的都是屬於主的。

words.definition: to fill, to be full of

words.note: Refers to God or Christ in Christian contexts.

verses.text: 如果有不信的人邀請你們吃飯，你們也願意去，凡擺在你們面前的，都可以吃，不要為了良心的緣故問甚麼。

words.note: Lit. 'people who do not believe'.
A common verb-object compound.

verses.text: 但是如果有人告訴你們：「這是獻過祭的食物。」那麼，為了那告訴你們的人，也為了良心的緣故，就不要吃。

words.note: 獻祭 (xiànjì) is a compound meaning 'to offer sacrifice'.

verses.text: 我說的良心，不是你的，而是他的。為甚麼我的自由要受別人的良心論斷呢？

words.definition: to suffer, to undergo, to receive
words.note: Often indicates passive voice when followed by an agent.

verses.text: 我若存著感恩的心吃了，為甚麼我因著我所感恩的食物被人毀謗呢？
所以，你們或吃喝，或作甚麼，一切都要為 神的榮耀而行。

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: The preceding space is a reverential mark, not part of the word.
Connects purpose/result, often 'so as to' or 'in order to'.

verses.text: 無論是猶太人，是希臘人，是 神的教會，你們總不可使他們跌倒；

words.note: 猶太 (Judea) + 人 (person).
希臘 (Greece) + 人 (person).
The preceding space is a reverential mark, not part of the word.
Literally 'teaching assembly'.
Can refer to physical falling or moral/spiritual stumbling.

verses.text: 就好像我所作的一切，都是要使大家喜悅，不是要求自己的好處，而是要求別人的好處，為了要使他們得救。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase with a following verb.
Literally 'big family'.

words.definition: in order to, for the sake of
